div.p: Allow me, dear Dr Hooker, to offer you my best felicitation to the New year. May it be to you & your family a joyous one.

To me it has commenced in deep sadness and undeserved humiliation, arising mainly from the shameless persecution of Mr Edw Wilson’s papers since a low person from an other journal took charge of the horticultural section of the Argus & Australasian. What a poor triumph for a once respectable paper to rob me of my Director ship and disgrace by the grossest misrepresentations my name, and try to to
and try to interlined above name, to bring. bring permanently the independent administration of a botanic garden into the power of a common gardener without any merit of even the slightest kind, but who last year was fined for drunkenness & streetrow before our own police court!
See M to J. Hooker, 6 November 1870, in this edition as 70-11-06a, for the allegation that William Ferguson had been fined for drunkenness in October 1870.
Be it enough. These things can only happen in Victoria! —

I got the two cases with dry plants. A splendid addition to our collections.
The contents of the cases have not been identified.
Accept my best thanks for this generous gift.
